page.title: 17Farming near Calbourne
page.content: The land around Calbourne is a mixture of chalk and clay. The chalky downland is generally used as {permanent pasture}for beef stock and sheep. Below this, where the soil is mixed, much of the land is used for{ {cereals.}The heavier clay land is frequently used for the growing of kale, sweetcorn, cabbages, potatoes, swedes, oil seed rape and pasture for hay and autumn grazing. There is a herd of{Dairy Cows}at Pitts Farm supplying milk both locally and by tanker to the Milk Marketing Board. There is a second herd at Lodge Farm which only supplies the Milk Marketing Board.
